This is the worst NON apple phone ever.  It is very slick and difficult to handle, resulting in it frequently crashing to the floor.  I have used several apps that require the phone to be rest by removing frquently the battery--something that cannot be done with the S8.  The curved screen results in apps too often being opened inadvertently.  There appears to be no way to disable Bixby and the button is in a very difficult spot to avoid--extremely annoying.  Much of the functionality of previous devices is gone or virtually impossible to find.  Worst of all, IT CAME WITH NO INSTRUCTIONS!!!!!!!!!!!  THIS WILL BE MY LAST SAMSUNG PHONE.
Galaxy is the best!

I checked online to see if this phone was compatible, verizon website confirmed it was but I needed a new SIM for it as mine was an older model.  When I got there all they would say was that this phone was incompatible with their network and there was nothing I could do.  Ordered the SIM through their website so I'll update if it actually works, but so far it's been a no go for Verizon.
I would not buy another one my husband and I both bought one and the screens cracked even with the screen protectors.within the month.
If I could disable bixby button I would give this phone 5 starts.

I've had this phone for a day.  It was an emergency replacement for my S7.  I wasn't too excited about upgrading to the 8 for 1 reason... the lack of a physical home button.  I thought that like everything else in the touch screen world, the new home area would be unresponsive at times and I've been right.  Several times today, I've had to tap the home area 2 or 3 times before the phone realizes I want it to wake up.The other issue is the location of the fingerprint reader.  Now on the back of the phone, it's tough to get your finger lined up properly without flipping the phone over to look at what you're doing,  The facial recognition seems to be pretty good though.The performance seems great.  It's very responsive.  Some of the new shortcuts seem helpful.  I'm sure I'll get used to it over the coming weeks, but out of the box, I think Samsung should have left some things alone.

Excellent product.I come from Xperia smartphones, this is my first galaxy and truly it's the best, It's worth.Package arrived in time and with all the stuffs (quick charger, usb cable, earphones (not the best).Highly recommended, with quick charge you can charge it at 100 percent in aprox 1 hour.
Performance is great. The display and the camera need special mention here. So, does Bixby button - it is a ergonomic nightmare and absolutely useless.

After great experiences with my s4 & Note 4 i couldn't pass up the Prime day deal on the S8. The camera is crazy and the phone itself is solid as a brick (and looks  good just sitting there). Nougat and Bixby take some getting used to (I haven't given up and resorted to a custom launcher yet). You can't customize LED colors for different apps/callers. There's still one tiny speaker instead of adopting stereo speakers like other companies. But my biggest complaint is the Bluetooth is Fubar. The forums are full of people that can't get this series phone to sync with radios or speakers. I've tried three cars and two speakers and the only thing it successfully pairs with is the controller for the VR headset. Thankfully my Note4 works just fine for mobile entertainment, but I can't use my car's hands-free calling features.It's a fine phone, Still has a headphone jack...which apparently I'll need for music since the Bluetooth doesn't work right, but is missing stuff that should have been caught before shipping.
Great battery life. Getting through a full day of work under heavy use with 30% battery left. With my battery case on, it getting 2 day battery!
Great phone.

I love this phone, when I say Love. I love this phone! Its awesome, it came with everything included in the box and was easy to set up with the phone company of my choice.

I love my new phone.  My first upgrade in years.

Bought at Sam's Club. 17 days after owning the phone it would no longer charge at the port. There was  defect in the connection. I contacted the company.  They had me send in the phone for repair.  Eleven days later (yesterday) I got my phone back. Charging port worked fine, but then the phone kept shutting down and restarting. I couldn't even get it to stay on long enough to set it up. I contacted the company again and I have sent off the phone again for repairs. Where the phone is barely used I wish they would just replace it so that I could have an experience without a defective phone.  I spent a lot of money on this phone.  The phone is beautiful in design, but I was not going for beauty, just reliability, and it failed, miserably.  Because of this experience with the phone and customer service, this is, most likely, my last Samsung phone purchase. If you buy this phone, you'll need the warranty. Unfortunately,  I didn't buy the warranty. I had already paid more than intended for the phone. I didn't have the funds for the warranty.

By now, all phones should be stronger/more impact resistant for dropping without a case.  Hopefully the Note 9 will be better meaning shorter, wider and stronger.

1rst and biggest, you have to get a case. This phone is so slippery it's silly. I set it on a pillow the other morning it would not stay.  gravity slowly Slid it off. I've dropped this 600$ phone twice in less than a week. It has rounded/tappered edges hardly any bezel to get a purchase on. Yes this is normally a good thing, but dropping sucks.2nd finger print sensor is in a poorly thought out spot next to camera lens. It's hard to say where to place it because it feels natural where they put it. Maybe move camera, Regardless your camera lens Will be smudged.3rd bixby not interested in it and I don't have a choice. The dedicated button is in the worst spot.  If I hold phone in landscape to take pic, watch video, or what ever I hit the button (by the way I'm left handed) with thumb. Phone is so slick holding in landscape position is precarious already. Samsung and bloatware, bixby is to much and to dedicate an annoying button to it is absolutely dumb.4th the screen is curved on edges and can be touched or tapped. I have big hands, phone is slick, phone is thin, and edges are round so i try to grip it good especially in landscape. Watching a YouTube video as an example either I hit bixby button or  accidently hit top left corner  of screen dropping notifications bar down or in YouTube back video up 10 seconds(how i am double tapping is beyond me). I have ordered a case it's been a week waiting on shipping I hope this fixes most of these problems. Being one of the more expensive phones out there, You would think these things would be thought through.5th I liked having removable battery option but LG doesn't offer any more. So I am assuming no decent smart phone has that option anymore. But on average I get a new phone every 2-3 years and generally battery would be replaced once in that time. 600$-700$ it should last that long. Seems to be a rant but for the money it should be better. And for god sakes stop with the bloatware, and a dedicated physical button. Seems like your are trying to piss off customers.

This is a great phone with a great screen and battery life!  A definite step up from my S6!  Battery lasts all day no problem.  A couple of personal notes.. I do not like the taller form factor as compared to the S6.  This one sticks out of my  jean pocket a bit.  And I am not a fan of the Bixby button.  I understand the money involved in Samsung getting into the voice business but the location of the Bixby button is terrible.. there has got to be another way.  I disabled mine but when the S8 upgrades to Android One UI it will no longer be possible to fully disable it.  I also prefer a flat screen to a screen with curved edges. Despite my notes.. this is a great phone.. I recommend it.
